Class MT5Account

Object
MT5Account
public class MT5Account extends Object
MT5 Account API Class High-level Java client for MetaTrader 5 terminal via gRPC. Provides convenient methods for trading, market data, and account management.

  • Constructor Details

    • MT5Account

      public MT5Account(long user, String password, String grpcServer, UUID id)
      Create MT5 account connection
      Parameters:
      user - MT5 account number
      password - MT5 account password
      grpcServer - gRPC server address (default: "grpc.mt5.mrpc.pro:443")
      id - Optional instance ID (generated if null)

    • connect

      public Mt5TermApiConnection.ConnectReply connect(String host, int port, String baseChartSymbol, boolean waitForTerminalIsAlive, int timeoutSeconds) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Connect to MT5 terminal by host and port
      Parameters:
      host - MT5 server host (IP or domain)
      port - MT5 server port (default 443)
      baseChartSymbol - Base chart symbol (e.g. "EURUSD")
      waitForTerminalIsAlive - Wait for terminal to be ready
      timeoutSeconds - Timeout in seconds
      Returns:
      Connection response with terminal instance GUID
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if connection fails

    • connectProxy

      public Mt5TermApiConnection.ConnectProxyReply connectProxy(String host, int port, String proxyUser, String proxyPassword, String proxyHost, int proxyPort, Mt5TermApiConnection.ProxyTypes proxyType, String baseChartSymbol, boolean waitForTerminalIsAlive, int timeoutSeconds) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Connect to MT5 terminal through proxy server
      Parameters:
      host - MT5 server host
      port - MT5 server port
      proxyUser - Proxy username
      proxyPassword - Proxy password
      proxyHost - Proxy server host
      proxyPort - Proxy server port
      proxyType - Proxy type (Socks5, Socks4, Https, None)
      baseChartSymbol - Base chart symbol
      waitForTerminalIsAlive - Wait for terminal readiness
      timeoutSeconds - Terminal readiness timeout
      Returns:
      Connection response with terminal GUID
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if connection fails

    • reconnect

      public Mt5TermApiConnection.ReconnectReply reconnect(boolean forceReconnection, int timeoutSeconds) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Reconnect to terminal (recreate terminal instance if needed)
      Parameters:
      forceReconnection - Force reconnection even if terminal is alive
      timeoutSeconds - Terminal readiness timeout
      Returns:
      Reconnect response with terminal info
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if reconnection fails

    • accountSummary

      public Mt5TermApiAccountHelper.AccountSummaryReply accountSummary() throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Gets the complete summary of the trading account in a single call. Returns all essential account information including balance, equity, margin, profit, leverage, and currency. This is the recommended method for retrieving account data as it minimizes network calls.
      Returns:
      Account summary containing all account properties
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost

    • accountInfoDouble

      public Mt5TermApiAccountInformation.AccountInfoDoubleReply accountInfoDouble(Mt5TermApiAccountInformation.AccountInfoDoublePropertyType propertyType) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Retrieves a specific double-precision property of the trading account. Use this to get individual numeric values such as BALANCE, EQUITY, MARGIN, PROFIT, etc.
      Parameters:
      propertyType - The specific property to retrieve (e.g., ACCOUNT_BALANCE, ACCOUNT_EQUITY)
      Returns:
      Response containing the requested double value
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost

    • accountInfoInteger

      public Mt5TermApiAccountInformation.AccountInfoIntegerReply accountInfoInteger(Mt5TermApiAccountInformation.AccountInfoIntegerPropertyType propertyType) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Retrieves a specific integer property of the trading account. Use this to get values such as LOGIN, LEVERAGE, TRADE_MODE, LIMIT_ORDERS, etc.
      Parameters:
      propertyType - The specific property to retrieve (e.g., ACCOUNT_LOGIN, ACCOUNT_LEVERAGE)
      Returns:
      Response containing the requested integer value
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost

    • accountInfoString

      public Mt5TermApiAccountInformation.AccountInfoStringReply accountInfoString(Mt5TermApiAccountInformation.AccountInfoStringPropertyType propertyType) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Retrieves a specific string property of the trading account. Use this to get textual information such as account NAME, SERVER, CURRENCY, or COMPANY.
      Parameters:
      propertyType - The specific property to retrieve (e.g., ACCOUNT_NAME, ACCOUNT_SERVER)
      Returns:
      Response containing the requested string value
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost

    • quote

      public Mt5TermApiMarketInfo.SymbolInfoTickRequestReply quote(String symbol) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Gets the current market quote (Bid/Ask prices) for a trading symbol. This is a convenience method that internally calls symbolInfoTick().
      Parameters:
      symbol - Trading symbol name (e.g., "EURUSD", "GBPUSD")
      Returns:
      Current tick data including bid, ask, last price, and volume
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost

    • quoteMany

      public Mt5TermApiMarketInfo.SymbolInfoTickRequestReply[] quoteMany(String[] symbols) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Get quotes for multiple symbols Note: Calls symbolInfoTick for each symbol sequentially
      Parameters:
      symbols - Array of symbol names
      Returns:
      Array of symbol info ticks
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if any call fails

    • symbolsTotal

      public Mt5TermApiMarketInfo.SymbolsTotalReply symbolsTotal(boolean selectedOnly) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Gets the total count of available symbols on the MT5 server. Returns either all symbols known to the server or only those currently shown in the MarketWatch window. Use this to determine how many symbols are available before requesting detailed symbol information.
      Parameters:
      selectedOnly - If true, returns only symbols visible in MarketWatch; if false, returns all available symbols
      Returns:
      Total number of symbols matching the filter criteria
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost

    • symbolInfoTick

      public Mt5TermApiMarketInfo.SymbolInfoTickRequestReply symbolInfoTick(String symbol) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Gets the latest tick data for a specified symbol. Returns real-time market information including current bid/ask prices, last trade price, volume, and timestamp. This is the primary method for retrieving current market prices for trading decisions.
      Parameters:
      symbol - Symbol name (e.g., "EURUSD", "GBPUSD")
      Returns:
      Latest tick data with bid/ask prices, last price, volume, and time
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost

    • symbolSelect

      public Mt5TermApiMarketInfo.SymbolSelectReply symbolSelect(String symbol, boolean select) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Selects or deselects a symbol in the Market Watch window. Symbols must be selected in Market Watch to receive price updates and place trades.
      Parameters:
      symbol - Symbol name (e.g., "EURUSD")
      select - True to select symbol, false to remove from Market Watch
      Returns:
      Reply with success status
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost

    • symbolInfoDouble

      public Mt5TermApiMarketInfo.SymbolInfoDoubleReply symbolInfoDouble(String symbol, Mt5TermApiMarketInfo.SymbolInfoDoubleProperty property) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Gets a double property value for a specified symbol. Used to retrieve numeric properties like point size, spread, volume limits, etc.
      Parameters:
      symbol - Symbol name (e.g., "EURUSD")
      property - Property type (SYMBOL_POINT, SYMBOL_VOLUME_MIN, etc.)
      Returns:
      Reply with the property value
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost

    • symbolInfoInteger

      public Mt5TermApiMarketInfo.SymbolInfoIntegerReply symbolInfoInteger(String symbol, Mt5TermApiMarketInfo.SymbolInfoIntegerProperty property) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Gets an integer property value for a specified symbol. Used to retrieve integer properties like digits, spread in points, trade mode, etc.
      Parameters:
      symbol - Symbol name (e.g., "EURUSD")
      property - Property type (SYMBOL_DIGITS, SYMBOL_SPREAD, etc.)
      Returns:
      Reply with the property value
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost

    • symbolInfoString

      public Mt5TermApiMarketInfo.SymbolInfoStringReply symbolInfoString(String symbol, Mt5TermApiMarketInfo.SymbolInfoStringProperty property) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Gets a string property value for a specified symbol. Used to retrieve string properties like base currency, description, path, etc.
      Parameters:
      symbol - Symbol name (e.g., "EURUSD")
      property - Property type (SYMBOL_CURRENCY_BASE, SYMBOL_DESCRIPTION, etc.)
      Returns:
      Reply with the property value
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost

    • symbolExist

      public Mt5TermApiMarketInfo.SymbolExistReply symbolExist(String symbolName) throws ApiExceptionMT5
      Checks if a symbol exists on the MT5 server. Returns whether the specified symbol name is available for trading.
      Parameters:
      symbolName - Symbol name to check (e.g., "EURUSD")
      Returns:
      Reply with existence status
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost

      Opens an internal chart for a symbol with a specified expert mode for receiving trading events. Creates a background chart that can trigger callbacks based on ticks, trades, or profit changes. Use this for event-driven trading logic without displaying a visible chart in the terminal.

      symbolName - Symbol name for the chart (e.g., "EURUSD")
      expertMode - Event mode (ON_TICK, ON_TRADE, ON_ORDER_PROFIT, ON_OPENED_ORDERS_TICKETS, ON_TRADE_TRANSACTION)
      timerPeriod - Optional timer period in milliseconds for periodic events (null if not needed)
      ignoreEmptyData - Optional flag to skip events when data hasn't changed (null for default behavior)
      Returns:
      Chart ID for the opened internal chart
      Throws:
      ApiExceptionMT5 - if the call fails or connection is lost
